amendment.description: Amendment sought to prohibit any funds appropriated in the bill from being used to carry out any extension service program for tobacco crops, or to provide crop insurance for tobacco for the 1996 or later crop years.
amendment.purpose: An amendment printed in the Congressional Record of July 18, as amendment No. 51, to prohibit any funds appropriated in the bill from being used to carry out any extension service program for tobacco crops, or to provide crop insurance for tobacco after the 1995 crop.

action.text: Mr. Ewing raised a point of order against the Durbin amendment (A017). Mr. Ewing stated that provisions of the amendment consisted of legislation on an appropriations bill and was, therefore in violation of the rules of the House. Point of order overruled by the Chair.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Durbin amendment (A017) Failed by recorded vote: 199 - 223 (Roll no. 544).
